medical_history.chief_complaint: Mr. A presented with symptoms of arm pain bilaterally, worsening movement disorder, and dyspnea, ultimately diagnosed with congestive heart failure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. A's symptoms began as mild movement disorder at age 18, worsening over time. He had a psychotic exacerbation after 14 years of stability. After an upper respiratory infection, he experienced bilateral arm pain and an increase in his movement disorder, which worsened over 8 months along with psychiatric symptoms. He eventually developed chest pain and dyspnea leading to a diagnosis of congestive heart failure.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic undifferentiated schizophrenia, history of psychotic behavior since age 16, and a movement disorder of unclear origin.
medical_history.social_history: Mr. A is unemployed, lives with family, and is supported by Supplemental Security Income. He has been compliant with outpatient psychiatric care and has a supportive family and clinic community.
